text: many countries around the world are
still seen to discriminate against those
who shun religion they take a closer
look now at the numbers for you a 2012
study on religion and atheism showed
that the countries with the largest
populations of atheists were China Japan
and the Czech Republic but many atheists
faced hostility in their home countries
according to a report released last year
by the International humanist and
ethical Union 77 countries around the
world are seen to discriminate against
atheists these include countries such as
India America and some of the EU states
of those 17 countries 13 have imposed
the death penalty for citizens who
reject the state's official religion
include the Maldives Morocco Saudi
Arabia and V UAE
